title: Brussels Sprouts with Orange
summary: Brussels Sprouts with Orange is a gluten free, primal, and vegetarian side dish. For $1.14 per serving, this recipe covers 15% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe makes 6 servings with 182 calories, 4g of protein, and 5g of fat each. 1 person found this recipe to be flavorful and satisfying. If you have brussels sprouts, orange juice, shallot, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 1 hour. With a spoonacular score of 49%, this dish is pretty good. Try Orange-Kissed Brussels Sprouts, Blood Orange Brussels Sprouts, and Orange-buttered Brussels Sprouts for similar recipes.
instructions: Instructions                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Using a small knife, remove the outer leaves from the Brussels sprouts. To help the sprouts cook evenly and quickly, cut an "x" into the bottom of each one.                                                     Bring a large saucepan of lightly salted water to a boil over high heat. Add the sprouts, return to a boil, and cook about 8 minutes, or until barely tender. Drain well. Let stand until cool enough to handle. Cut each sprout in half lengthwise.                                                     Melt the butter in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the shallot and cook, stirring often, about 3 minutes or until golden brown. Add the sprouts and cook, stirring often, about 2 minutes until heated through.                                                     Stir in the orange zest and juice and cook for 2 minutes, or until the liquid is reduced by half. Remove from the heat and stir in the lime juice. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                var articleType_27_data = {};                    articleType_27_data.init_step_by_step_images = 0;

steps.step: Using a small knife, remove the outer leaves from the Brussels sprouts. To help the sprouts cook evenly and quickly, cut an "x" into the bottom of each one.
Bring a large saucepan of lightly salted water to a boil over high heat.
Add the sprouts, return to a boil, and cook about 8 minutes, or until barely tender.
Let stand until cool enough to handle.
Cut each sprout in half lengthwise.
Melt the butter in a large frying pan over medium-high heat.
Add the shallot and cook, stirring often, about 3 minutes or until golden brown.
Add the sprouts and cook, stirring often, about 2 minutes until heated through.
Stir in the orange zest and juice and cook for 2 minutes, or until the liquid is reduced by half.
Remove from the heat and stir in the lime juice. Season with salt and pepper.
